content.description:
First pitch is quite dirty and slightly moist due to this route attracting a lot of run-off (even though we climbed it many days after last rainfall). Second pitch also wet (we didn't climb it as the first couple bolts were too wet). Would be a fun two pitch outing if route was dry. If wet likely easier to try harder (but drier) climbs to the left



Furthest pitch on hillside wall (highest up the hill) before the path continues to Louise falls

Bolted pitches to bolted anchors

Just right of the arching roof.  About 150 feet uphill from the trail

Sport.  7 bolts
Just right of the arching roof.  About 150 feet uphill from the trail
Sport.  7 bolts

Fantastic first pitch. Keep your balance on somewhat thin, sustained face climbing in the first third. Conserve your energy on the relatively easy middle third. Gather your energy for a spectacular final third on the arete, finding big blocky holds just where you need them.

The second pitch is not as memorable, climbing wise and if you attempt to link it you'll encounter a lot of rope drag. It will give you a slightly better view of the lake.

On a 60m rope, will require three rappels. The 4th bolt from the bottom has an ring to rappel from. Can just be done in 2 rappels using a 70m rope.

The first line of bolts as you hike up the hill right from the trailside section. Just to the left of the Incredible Talking Woman line.
14 bolts, 5 bolts

Sustained thin climbing for the first 4 bolts eases off slightly before a small crux move that you will likely find easier than the first half of the route.

Left of "Fiddler on the Roof" roof, first bolt line on the left after the long arching roof ends.
8 bolts to a bolted anchor.

tricky and slick.  
 crux is low

8 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor

P1 (5.10b): 9 Bolts, 2 Bolt Anchor w/ Rap rings. The route is fairly easy off the ground but transitions into a tricky layback crack/flake about 50 feet up. Grunt your way through about 10 feet of laybacking and then enjoy the hike to the finish. Be careful of the large loose block above the crux. P2 (5.10c): 11 Bolts, 2 Bolt anchor w/ Rap rings The second route to the right of the arching roof, just uphill from "Fiddler on the Roof" P1: 9 Bolts, 2 Bolt anchor w/ Rap Rings

P2: 11 Bolts, 2 Bolt anchor w/ Rap Rings

Great two pitch climb to excellent views of the lake. May get run-off and dirty at times, so climb if its in condition!Â 

First pitch is relatively straight-forward with good holds and feet. Second pitch has good climbing up to a (well protected) roof move that is very fun, keep moving through this part! Unfortunately the crux is after the roof and just below the anchor, where in the orange rock the holds get thin! Fun moves!



Immediately right of Traffic, bolt line of first pitch goes up to a nice ledge immediately right of large pine tree growing on ledge (Traffic is left of this tree)

Bolted (6 P1 and 12 P2) to bolted anchors

Often wet first pitch, excellent crimpy second pitch

2 bolt lines to the right of Fiddler on the Roof (the big arch). Just to the left of the log leaning against the wall
bolts and chains
Up the hill from the Trailside crag. Several bolted routes
